recipes.title: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add milk, eggs, oil, and vanilla to the dry ingredients and mix until smooth.
Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch cake pan.
Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let cool before serving.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the spaghetti until al dente.
While the pasta cooks, fry the pancetta in a pan over medium heat until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and parmesan cheese.
Drain the spaghetti and reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Add the spaghetti to the pan with the pancetta and garlic, tossing to combine.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture, adding pasta water to achieve a creamy sauce.
Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Greek Salad
instructions: In a large salad bowl, combine the tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion.
Add the feta cheese and olives on top.
Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar.
Sprinkle with salt and oregano.
Toss gently and serve fresh.

recipes.title: Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the onions until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, cooking for 2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the spices (turmeric, cumin, coriander, and chili) and stir well.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in the tomato puree and mix to coat the chicken.
Add water, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes until the chicken is tender.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.title: Pancakes
ingredients: 2 tbsp of melted butter or vegetable oil
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the egg, milk, and melted butter.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients, mixing until just combined (lumps are okay).
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and grease lightly.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve warm with syrup or toppings of choice.

recipes.title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
ingredients: Optional: 1 tbsp of cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp of water for thickening
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-frying for 1 minute.
Add the carrots, broccoli, and snap peas. Cook for 4–5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Add the red bell pepper and cook for another 2 minutes.
Stir in the soy sauce and cornstarch slurry (if using) and cook for 1–2 minutes until sauce thickens.
Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

recipes.title: Fish Tacos
ingredients: 2 fillets of white fish (e.g., cod or tilapia)
instructions: Preheat a grill or pan over medium-high heat.
Rub the fish fillets with olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Grill or pan-fry the fish for 3–4 minutes per side until cooked through.
Warm the tortillas on a dry skillet or in the oven.
Assemble tacos by placing fish, shredded cabbage, sour cream, and a squeeze of lime in each tortilla.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Season the beef strips with salt and pepper.
Heat butter in a skillet and sear the beef until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté onions and garlic until soft.
Add mushrooms and cook until browned.
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and stir well.
Gradually add the beef broth, stirring to avoid lumps.
Stir in sour cream and Dijon mustard, then add the beef back to the skillet.
Simmer for 10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot over noodles or rice, garnished with parsley.

recipes.title: Tomato Soup
ingredients: Optional: 1/4 cup of cream for richness
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Sauté the onion and garlic until fragrant and soft.
Add the chopped tomatoes and basil, cooking for 10 minutes.
Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Blend the soup until smooth using an immersion blender or regular blender.
Optional: Stir in cream for added richness.
Serve hot with crusty bread.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, cream together butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar.
Add the egg and vanilla extract to the butter mixture and mix well.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 10–12 minutes until the edges are golden brown.
Let cool before serving.

recipes.title: Caesar Salad
ingredients: Optional: Grilled chicken or shrimp for protein
instructions: In a large bowl, toss the chopped romaine lettuce with Caesar dressing.
Add croutons and parmesan cheese, mixing gently to combine.
Optional: Top with grilled chicken or shrimp for a more filling meal.
Serve immediately.
